snippet: Target has been trying to stop Amazon shoppers from checking products at Target stores and then buying them from Amazon.
abstract: Target, signaling its growing irritation with its rival Amazon, says it will stop selling Amazon Kindle e-readers; it has been trying to stop Amazon shoppers from checking products at Target stores and then buying them online from Amazon. Photo (M)

byline.original: By STEPHANIE CLIFFORD and JULIE BOSMAN

lead_paragraph: Target, signaling its growing irritation with its rival Amazon, announced on Wednesday that it would stop selling the online retailer's Kindle e-readers. Target, with almost 1,800 stores, is one of the bigger carriers of Kindles in the offline world, though most of the devices are sold at Amazon's Web site.

headline.main: Target, Unhappy With Being an Amazon Showroom, Will Stop Selling Kindles
